TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract Axis

Docs.summary: Represents a single axis in a chart.

remarks.para: The object is a member of the collection.

Use (, ) where is the axis type and is the axis group to return a single object. can be one of the following constants: , , or . can be one of the following constants: or . For more information, see the method.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Application As Object
public: property System::Object ^ Application { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: When used without an object qualifier, this property returns an object that represents the Microsoft Word application. When used with an object qualifier, this property returns an object that represents the creator of the specified object (you can use this property with an OLE Automation object to return the application of that object). Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AxisBetweenCategories { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the value axis crosses the category axis between categories. Read/write.

remarks.para: This property applies only to category axes, and it doesn't apply to 3-D charts.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property AxisGroup As XlAxisGroup

Docs.summary: Returns the type of axis group. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property AxisTitle As AxisTitle

Docs.summary: Returns the title of the specified axis. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlTimeUnit BaseUnit { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlTimeUnit get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlTimeUnit value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the base unit for the specified category axis. Read/write.

remarks.para: Setting this property has no visible effect if the property for the specified axis is set to . The set value is retained, however, and takes effect when the property is set to .
You cannot set this property for a value axis.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool BaseUnitIsAuto { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if Microsoft Word chooses appropriate base units for the specified category axis. The default value is True. Read/write.

remarks.para: You cannot set this property for a value axis.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Border As ChartBorder

Docs.summary: Returns the border of the object. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Object ^ CategoryNames { System::Object ^ get(); void set(System::Object ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets all the category names for the specified axis, as a text array. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlCategoryType CategoryType { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlCategoryType get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlCategoryType value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the category axis type. Read/write.

remarks.para: You cannot set this property for a value axis.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Creator As Integer
public: property int Creator { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a 32-bit integer that indicates the application in which the specified object was created. Read-only.

remarks.para: If the object was created in Microsoft Word, the property returns the hexadecimal number 4D535744, which represents the string "MSWD." This property was primarily designed to be used on the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Word has the creator code MSWD. For additional information about this property, consult the language reference Help included with Microsoft Office Macintosh Edition.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlAxisCrosses Crosses { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlAxisCrosses get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlAxisCrosses value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the point on the specified axis where the other axis crosses. Read/write.

remarks.para: This property isn't available for radar charts. For 3-D charts, this property can only be applied to the value axis and indicates where the plane defined by the category axes crosses the value axis.
This property can be used for both category and value axes. On the category axis, sets the value axis to cross at the first category, and sets the value axis to cross at the last category.
Note that and can have different meanings, depending on the axis.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property double CrossesAt { double get(); void set(double value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the point on the value axis where the category axis crosses it. Applies only to the value axis. Read/write.

remarks.para: Setting this property causes the property to change to .
This property cannot be used on radar charts. For 3-D charts, this property indicates where the plane defined by the category axes crosses the value axis.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object Delete() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Deletes the object.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlDisplayUnit DisplayUnit { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlDisplayUnit get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlDisplayUnit value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the unit label for the value axis. Read/write.

remarks.para: Using unit labels when charting large values makes your tick mark labels easier to read. For example, if you label your value axis in units of hundreds, thousands, or millions, you can use smaller numeric values at the tick marks on the axis.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property double DisplayUnitCustom { double get(); void set(double value); };

Docs.summary: If the value of the property is , the property returns or sets the value of the displayed units. The value must be from 0 through 10E307. Read/write.

remarks.para: Using unit labels when charting large values makes your tick mark labels easier to read. For example, if you label your value axis in units of hundreds, thousands, or millions, you can use smaller numeric values at the tick marks on the axis.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property DisplayUnitLabel As DisplayUnitLabel

Docs.summary: Returns the object for the specified axis. Returns Nothing if the property is set to False. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Format As ChartFormat

Docs.summary: Returns the line, fill, and effect formatting for the object. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool HasDisplayUnitLabel { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the label specified by the or property is displayed on the specified axis. The default value is True. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool HasMajorGridlines { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the axis has major gridlines. Only axes in the primary axis group can have gridlines. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool HasMinorGridlines { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the axis has minor gridlines. Only axes in the primary axis group can have gridlines. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool HasTitle { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the axis or chart has a visible title. Read/write.

remarks.para: An axis title is represented by an object.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Height As Double
public: property double Height { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the height, in points, of the object.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Left As Double
public: property double Left { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the distance, in points, from the left edge of the object to the left edge of the chart area.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property double LogBase { double get(); void set(double value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the base of the logarithm when you are using log scales. Read/write.

remarks.para: Attempting to set this property to a value less than or equal to zero (0) causes an error. The default value is 10.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property MajorGridlines As Gridlines

Docs.summary: Returns the major gridlines for the specified axis. Only axes in the primary axis group can have gridlines. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlTickMark MajorTickMark { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlTickMark get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlTickMark value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the type of major tick mark for the specified axis. Read/write .

MemberSignature.Value: public: property double MajorUnit { double get(); void set(double value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the major units for the value axis. Read/write.

remarks.para: Setting this property sets the property to False.
Use the property to set tick mark spacing on the category axis.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool MajorUnitIsAuto { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if Microsoft Word calculates the major units for the value axis. Read/write.

remarks.para: Setting the property sets this property to False.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlTimeUnit MajorUnitScale { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlTimeUnit get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlTimeUnit value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the major unit scale value for the category axis when the property is set to . Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property double MaximumScale { double get(); void set(double value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the maximum value on the value axis. Read/write.

remarks.para: Setting this property sets the property to False.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool MaximumScaleIsAuto { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if Microsoft Word calculates the maximum value for the value axis. Read/write.

remarks.para: Setting the property sets this property to False.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property double MinimumScale { double get(); void set(double value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the minimum value on the value axis. Read/write.

remarks.para: Setting this property sets the property to False.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool MinimumScaleIsAuto { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if Microsoft Word calculates the minimum value for the value axis. Read/write.

remarks.para: Setting the property sets this property to False.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property MinorGridlines As Gridlines

Docs.summary: Returns the minor gridlines for the specified axis. Only axes in the primary axis group can have gridlines. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlTickMark MinorTickMark { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlTickMark get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlTickMark value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the type of minor tick mark for the specified axis. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property double MinorUnit { double get(); void set(double value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the minor units on the value axis. Read/write.

remarks.para: Setting this property sets the property to False.
Use the property to set tick mark spacing on the category axis.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool MinorUnitIsAuto { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if Microsoft Word calculates minor units for the value axis. Read/write.

remarks.para: Setting the property sets this property to False.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlTimeUnit MinorUnitScale { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlTimeUnit get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlTimeUnit value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the minor unit scale value for the category axis when the property is set to . Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Parent As Object
public: property System::Object ^ Parent { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the parent for the specified object. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ReversePlotOrder { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if Microsoft Word plots data points from last to first. Read/write.

remarks.para: This property cannot be used on radar charts.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlScaleType ScaleType { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlScaleType get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlScaleType value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the value axis scale type. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object Select() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Selects the object.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlTickLabelPosition TickLabelPosition { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlTickLabelPosition get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlTickLabelPosition value); };

Docs.summary: Describes the position of tick-mark labels on the specified axis. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property TickLabels As TickLabels

Docs.summary: Returns the tick-mark labels for the specified axis. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int TickLabelSpacing { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the number of categories or series between tick-mark labels. Applies only to category and series axes. Can be a value from 1 through 31999. Read/write.

remarks.para: Tick-mark label spacing on the value axis is always calculated by Microsoft Word.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool TickLabelSpacingIsAuto { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets whether or not the tick label spacing is automatic. Read/write.

remarks.para: The property returns the current tick label spacing, whether or not the setting is automatic.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int TickMarkSpacing { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the number of categories or series between tick marks. Applies only to category and series axes. Can be a value from 1 through 31999. Read/write.

remarks.para: Use the and properties to set tick-mark spacing on the value axis.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Top As Double
public: property double Top { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the distance, in points, from the top edge of the object to the top of row 1 (on a worksheet) or the top of the chart area (on a chart).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlAxisType Type { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlAxisType get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::XlAxisType value); };

Docs.summary: Returns the axis type.

remarks.para: When using this property for the horizontal axis of scatter charts, will be returned as the axis type.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Width As Double
public: property double Width { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the width, in points, of the object.
